intro: Chrysurus elegans, commonly known as the elegant chrysurus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
